summary: This document is a forwarded email chain from July 2021, primarily featuring communications from Richard C. Curtiss to various news organizations and government officials. Curtiss attempts to report on alleged corruption in the courts and government, and specifically offers information about being inside the SHU of the Metropolitan Correctional Center where Jeffrey Epstein died, questioning the circumstances of his death. The chain includes rejections from news editors and automated responses from government offices.

keyFacts: Richard C. Curtiss claims to have been inside the Special Housing Unit (SHU) of the Metropolitan Correctional Center where Jeffrey Epstein died and questions why guards turned cameras off and failed to perform 30-minute checks.
An email from an unnamed source suggests Epstein's death was expected ('bumped off') to prevent him from talking, and that Ghislaine Maxwell may hold a 'final stash' of blackmail material.
Attorney David Schoen, who met with Epstein the day he died, is quoted as saying he does not believe it was suicide and warned Epstein about dangers from 'these people' in the prison.

The document shows a pattern of Curtiss's attempts to report alleged widespread corruption among government employees, court employees, and judges to news outlets and politicians, with most rejecting his pitches.
The Chief Medical Examiner's office confirmed Epstein's death as a suicide by hanging but declined to specify if drug tests were performed as part of the investigation.
